ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Free study module (with enrolment key) for students purchasing another...
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Dave, I don't think it's possible to prevent students giving the enrolment key to others, however if you find unwanted people enrolling you can always unenrol them and change the key (which would not affect any legitimately enrolled users). Another option would be to not use an enrolment key for the free module, but instead to use the course meta link enrolment method to automatically enrol everyone who is enrolled in a purchased module in the free module too. Please see the documentation Course meta link for details.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: User Enrolment Expiry
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Dave, If you’ve set the expiry date of the enrolment  for students, you’ll get the expiry date from mdl_user_enrolments table with a column named "timeend" with respect to each other. And if you’ve  set the enrolment period for course, you’ll get the expiry date from mdl_enrol table with a column named "enrolperiod". The query will look like: $sql = "select mdl_enrol.enrolperiod as course_expiry_date, mdl_user_enrolments.timeend as user_course_expiry_date from mdl_enrol join mdl_user_enrolments on mdl_user_enrolments.enrolid = mdl_enrol.id where mdl_courseid=? and mdl_user_enrolments.userid=?"; I hope this’ll help you to resolve your issue. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: how can I enroll students manually?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi there. Put an enrolment key on your course (inside the course in adminstration>settings) The students willl not know the key if you don't tell them. That stops them getting in. Then in the course administration block click on assign roles - then student. You will see on the right a list of potential students - you select and move across to the box on the left the ones you want to be enrolled in the course.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: LDAP not syncing new accounts
ResponsesInList.Text: I solved the problem. It turns out our live database had the default collation set to a different unicode set from our mdl_user table. This meant than when the LDAP sync script created a temporary table, it couldn't join it with the table in Moodle to see who needs to be added. I've now changed the default collation to match that of mdl_user, and all is well!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Subscription based enrolment
ResponsesInList.Text: Ali: This is easy...  On the course settings, you can set the enrollment duration. Here is the help for this setting: This setting specifies the number of days a student can be enrolled in this course (starting from the moment they enroll). If this is set, then students are automatically unenrolled after the specified time has elapsed. This is most useful for rolling courses without a specific start or end time. If you don't set this then the student will remain in this course until they are manually unenrolled or the clean-up function to remove defunct students takes effect. If you have selected to manage this course as a meta course, your enrolment period will not be used.

ResponsesInList.Text: Looks like there is a bug with "moodle/course:view" capability. I was able to reproduce what you described above by modifying the Student role with "View courses without participation" (moodle/course:view) set to "Allow". I tried this in both Moodle 2.4.9 and Moodle 2.6, as well as on Moodle Demo (demo. moodle.net ). According to the definition of the "moodle/course:view" capability in http://docs.moodle.org/26/en/Capabilities/moodle/course:view , a user with this capability should be able to view this course without being enrolled, but the behaviour seems to be opposite. The current behaviour is that if the user has never been enrolled in this course, then s/he will not be able to view this course. But if s/he has enrolled in this course before (even the enrollment has turned off after), s/he will be able to view the course. I think the correct behaviour should be if the user has this capability (moodle/course:view) set to allowed, s/he should be able to view this course whether or not s/he is enrolled. Thoughts?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: 2checkout.com TOS
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi John, The accreditation from the awarding body for my elearning site customisations was for IOSH - Institude of Occupational Safety & Health. I believe OSHA is the Occupational Safety and Health Administration, which is pretty much the American equivalent to the HSE - Health and Safety Executive and IOSH combined from my understanding. I am unsure of OSHA's particular requirements to satisfy compliancy for elearning courses. You really need to ask them directly, however I would suspect that OSHA would prefer a SCORM elearning format, but don't quote me on that (we don't use SCORM btw ). The main issues for my part was ensuring that on-line examinations were in their words 'un-cheatable' which I satisfied by creating an on-line exam module based on the lesson module. Some changes were made for to prevent users accessing any other site contents whilst the examination was underway. That IS of course only applied to each users individual elearning account and IMO is not an effective way of prevent cheating as no-one is necessarily around to invidulate examination attempts. Unless of course the exams were taking in a controlled environment. Again my opinion was quashed as it is left for the tutors which marks the exam attempts to filter those students which have 'word for word' perfect answers. Due to the marking criteria the modle answers are worded in such a way that is unnatural for a human to phrase, so it becomes very obiovus when a user is somehow 'cheating' based on these modle answers. The modle answers are particularly concise, almost bullet points even for essay (long answer) type questions/answers. They were also particularly interested in interactivity for questions / quizzes within the content. I had (again) created another module based upon lesson mod and integrated new questions types that are found within the HotPot module, which allowed for drag & drop, jumbled sentence and a number of other question types not natively found within the lesson module. So i'd really look in to securing your site while students are under going examinations and making sure you have plenty of interactivity, however you wish to acheive this. We recently had an audit by IOSH and have recoded an upgraded version of our customisations from a 1.6.4 to a 1.8.8 moodle. IOSH were very happy with how we handled everything in terms of administration and we have built up a good relationship with them. They did stipulate that ALL exam attempts should be recorded, even the failed attempts, which we were not doing until our recent audit. Apparently we had a 100% pass rate, the highest out of any accredited provider. The reason for this is due to that fact that with the courses we provide students are allowed to reattempt if they have failed so long as a 10 day grace period is adhered to before a re-attempt. This effectively meant that we simply informed the students they failed and could retake a different exam in 10 days. As we send a monthly report to IOSH containing the results it was only the passing students that were sent as failed attempts were removed from our system; and any failures were not required to be sent. Originally IOSH did not stipulate they required ALL attempts pass or fail until our recent audit. I must say though, the inital accreditation was particularly difficult to satisfy and IOSH were very thorough in testing our elearning site in terms of both technical requirements and course content. They did however provide great feedback as to what exactly they wanted to see in the elearning site and their suggestions for improving content. Once the accreditation was gained everything has pretty much been smooth sailing .... I'm not sure if i can help you further, but you can always ask and I'll see if I can shed any light from my experiences. PS. Sorry for the length of time taken to responde, i've only just spotted your query. All the best and I hope you can satisfy their requirements. We have had an interest in providing OSHA courses ourselves and would be very interested to know what you find. Perhaps a collaboration may be good idea? Steve

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Is there a limit to the maximum number of students enrolled in a course? (through all possible enrolment methods)
ResponsesInList.Text: Not every enrolment method has a 'max enroled user' setting. So limiting all enrolment methods will not be that easy. One sample is the enrolment on payment: what will your plugin do if 2 users pay at the same time for the last seat? You will have to implement a refund for the person who lost. Another sample is the enrolment on course completion: you promise your students that if they complete Course A, they will be enrolled in Course B. But then your local plugin pops up and shows that the user completed the course but the maximum is reached, so the student cannot access Course B. Have also a look at the Cohort enrolment method, how will you implement a maximum when this maximum should be defined in the cohort? There is indeed not a "before user enrol event", first the enrolment record is created and next the user_enroled is fired. So you could modify the core code to implement such an event. but I have the impression this method will add more frustration than functionality, if students take the step to access a course, you should encourage them, not show some discouraging message like "Maximum number of students reached". Why do you not remove the enrol permissions (for each method) for these teachers?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Enrolment Questions
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi there. I'm not entirely sure what you mean but here goes anyway - 1) you don't want your students to log in? So you want guest access on all of your Moodle except you want the teachers to log in so they can put work on? Bearing in mind that with guest access anyone can see your courses - and that all you can do is put static resources on for them to read/watch (and nothing interactive such as forums or quizzes) if you go to site admin>users>user policies you can set your Moodle to autologin guests -and then you need to make each course in its course settings "open to guests without the key" However, I am not sure you mean this really.. is it perhaps 2) you only want your students to be in one particular course rather than assigned system wide? If your students are going to have safe (private)access to any course then they need to be enrolled onto your Moodle - but once you have created them a login you can then assign them manually to the course you want them in (course admin block>assign roles>student) What you don't need to do (in fact, shouldn't do)is assign them the role of student globally via site admin>users>permissions>assign system roles - this just makes them students throughout the whole of your Moodle and is not necessary. 3) Alternatively, just manually create Moodle logins for them and let them enrol themselves on their chosen course, rather than you do it.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: issue with "requireloginerror" message appearing when self enrolling
ResponsesInList.Text: For those struggling with this error, it also can mean that you have a reference to an asset in another course that the user does not have permission to view. In our case, we have several videotime videos that are "hidden" activities for students, but then referenced from within a content page inside a lesson by ID number of the hidden items.  The lesson can play those videos and the student has full visibility of the lesson.  When we copied our courses for this year from last year's courses, the videotime videos get copied into the new course as well (and receive new ID numbers).  The new lesson, referenced the previous course's videos.  Because our admins have access to all the courses, we never saw this error popup, and the videos played right away for us.  However, a student only enrolled in this year's course, would see the error because they are not enrolled in the previous course (where the video is being referenced.) The fix was to go into the current lessons, and update the video reference IDs in the content pages to point to the current course's video assets. For what it's worth, This error can also appear if you have a block like a calendar, or message block, set to appear inside your course content, that the user doesn't have permission to access. In short, it's telling you that something your page is calling is outside the permissions scope of that individual user.  A tricky little issue to diagnose unless you're logged in as a student.  I hope that helps someone out there!

ResponsesInList.Title: Automatic enrollment after completing multiple courses?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi everyone, I am looking for some advice about an enrollment scenario we have. We have three courses that are part of a single program. Some students enroll in all three courses, and if they successfully complete all 3, there is an overall certificate that they receive. I am planning to create a 4th course that contains the overall program certificate activity, which will be available once the other 3 courses have completed. I believe this will work OK but the part I am uncertain about is whether there is a way to automatically enroll students in that 4th course once they have completed all three courses. The complexity is that they can complete the required courses in any order, so it's not as simple as relying on sequence. We are using competencies in the courses but I have not found a way to use competency detection to control enrollment. Thanks for any assistance or guidance you can suggest!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Automatic enrollment after completing multiple courses?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Automatic enrollment after completing multiple courses?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Automatic enrollment after completing multiple courses?
ResponsesInList.Text: You could create a fourth course with a certificate where everybody has access. In the course completion configuration of this course you add the completion of the three courses as a requirement. Next, you use availability_coursecompleted as a requirement to access your certificate. This way students can complete the three required courses in any sequence, but they will only receive the certificate when the 3 required courses are completed.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Automatic enrollment after completing multiple courses?
ResponsesInList.Text: You can do this already with the enrol coursecompleted plugin: In one of your 3 courses add the two other courses as a requirement for course completion. This solution works for 3 courses, but also for 10 or 50.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Report on Number of Users Using Enrolment Key
ResponsesInList.Text: <<But I can't get information on how many guests came into the class with that code. Is what I'm looking for even possible?>> Since there is one and only one guest account, all these people are exactly the same as far as Moodle is concerned: one anonymous guest accessing the course many times. Guests don't use the enrollment keys because enrollment keys only pertain to proper enrollment of normal users using self-enrollment. Once used and enrolled, the enrollment key is not needed again by that user. The password you set for Guest access on a course is separate from that (and should be different.) The way to get information you want is from the site logs. You could search the logs for that specific course for guest access and then by counting the number of unique IP addresses, you will have a rough number of distinct accesses to that course. (Provided of course you are logging guest access, which you should be). If your site is using something like Google Analytics, that will give you similar data.

(Fake payment?)", $data); } } fclose($fp); flcose($log); exit; /// FUNCTIONS ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// function email_paypal_error_to_admin($subject, $data) { $admin = get_admin(); $site = get_site(); $message = "$site->fullname: Transaction failed. $subject "; foreach ($data as $key => $value) { $message .= "$key => $value "; } email_to_user($admin, $admin, "PAYPAL ERROR: ".$subject, $message); } ?>

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Authenticated user access to course
ResponsesInList.Text: There is often confusion between guest access for authentication and guest access for enrolment. If you require users to log in, and don’t allow “auto login of guests”, then guest enrolment will work perfectly well. It won’t allow anyone in to your site, but those who are already logged in will not be challenged when entering courses that allow guest access. The other alternative is to use something like the auto enrol plugins, which will automatically enrol users into a course based on criteria , or when they login, or when they access the course. See https://moodle.org/plugins/enrol_auto and https://moodle.org/plugins/enrol_autoenrol

ResponsesInList.Title: Changing Enrolment Status and User Role
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello! I am very new to using Moodle (I believe we have V.3.8), and I am trying to learn as much as possible as we continue to make use of the platform in lieu of in-person classes during the pandemic. I am wondering if it is possible to do the following: 1. When a new user is enrolled in a course, they are assigned the role of a student, and given an enrollment period of 365 days. 2. However, once the user has completed a course, we would like to be able to change their role to that of "graduate". This is a role site admin has created that is very similar to that of a guest (ie., they can look at the materials, but not participate in the course), but still requires the user to use their username and login to access the course. 3. When a student's role is changed from "student" to "graduate", is there a way to automatically remove their past assignments, lesson submissions, etc. from the course? 4. Does Moodle have a function where a user can be automatically changed from a "student" to a "graduate" after a certain period of time (that also removes their contributions, and just leaves them with general access to course material)? Essentially, what I'm trying to do is give users one year to use our Moodle resources. When they first begin, they are students, but once they have finished their program (typically about five weeks), I still want to them to be able to come back and look at the material over the course of the remaining year. However, we have new program enrollments every six weeks, so it gets cumbersome sifting through current and past submissions without just manually deleting things each time I login. I hope this all makes sense, and I hope someone is able to provide me with some insight on my question! Thanks in advance (and remember I'm not super technologically inclined. hahaha). 😊

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Changing Enrolment Status and User Role
ResponsesInList.Text: Most enrollment plugins let you specify a duration. The plugin enrol_coursecompleted let you add a role to a user when the course is completed (read everything about course completion and enrollment before implementing this). However this plugin does not remove the original role. Removing submissions and assignments from a student is not done automatically, but an enrollment plugin can be configured in different ways what to do when the enrollment expires: keep user enrolled - disable course enrollment - disable course enrollment and remove role - unroll user from course. NO A lot of what you try to do is possible, except the automatic removal of student data.  Plugins normally stay far away from removing information (you do not want that someone installs a plugin by mistake and all the submissions of the students are gone). R

ResponsesInList.Title: Self enrolment problem - solved - Moodle 2.5
ResponsesInList.Text: This wasted about 2 hours of my time  ... so it may help someone else. We recently upgraded  our Moodle from 1.9 to 2.2 and then did a course by course import into  2.5 (our database had issues as it dated from v1.08 in 2003). Our students arrived this week and the self enrolment plugin failed 'You can not enrol yourself in this course' - even though site and course self enrolment settings seemed fine. The solution seems very strange but, with lots of trial and error as I couldn't find the solution on this forum, goes like this: Go into the course (logged in as teacher/admin): Course admin>users>enrolment methods>self enrolment> set 'Unenrol inactive after' to 'never' rather than our default '365 days'. Save. Self enrolment now works and students see the 'enrol' button when they click on the course to enter. Even more strangely, self enrolment continued to work even if I put the setting back to 365 days later!!!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Self enrolment problem - solved - Moodle 2.5
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks so much for posting this issue and solution. I had exactly the same issue with courses imported from a 2.3 to a2.5 site. All the 'Unenrol inactive after' dates were set to 'Never' and setting them to 1800 days then gets self-enrollment working again. So it looks like just changing the setting will then "correct" the issue. This is obviously a bug in the way that setting is restored and so it appears that the Unenroll inactive dates are passed for everyone. I restored this course with existing users in it. That may be an interesting variable.

ResponsesInList.Title: Removing users from a cohort
ResponsesInList.Text: I enrolled students in many courses using a cohort. Now I want to unenroll these students deleting them from the cohort. How can I do it? They don't appear in the ‘Current users’ field bechause there are more then 100 students.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Removing users from a cohort
ResponsesInList.Text: The straightforward method would be: search the users in the left container one-by-one and move them to the right container. However, that is a time consuming job. My suggestion would be: Create a new and temporary cohort. Go to Site admin / Users / Accounts / Bulk user actions. Try to formulate criteria to select the users who should STAY in your original cohort. Go to the bottom of the page and add the selected users to the new temporary cohort. Add an enrolment method for this cohort to all the courses where your original cohort was used AFTER completion of the previous task,you may delete entirely the original cohort next, you rename the temporary cohort and give it the name of the original cohort Why these steps? I assume that selecting the staying users takes less time, than removing the "wrong" ones manually. Further, unenrolling and handling user data are complex issues. I want to avoid mistakes by misinterpreting the documentation. So, I add the new cohort first, and remove the old cohort later. By the way, this suggestion seems to fail if your cohort has been enrolled in many courses. Then, adding the cohort enrol method many times becomes the bottleneck. The good news is that Moodle 2.6 has an interesting " upload courses" feature, comparable to the well-known update users feature. The "upload course" feature also works with existing courses. It can be used for uploading enrollment methods as well. Unfortunately, uploading the cohort enrolment method is either not well documented or buggy or both. Please, vote for mdl bug tracker https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-43127 to have this solved asap en make this power tool available for us all.

We are looking to do some mass enrolling (could be as many as 10,000 users), and unfortunately the site may not have been set up properly.  After reading about how to do mass enrollments, I determined I need to add a txt file with the following: action, role, student ID, course Id add, student, 4285, C130 However, when adding new users over the past 2 years, customer service was not adding a Student ID to any new users.  I want to assume that it can be found when editing a users profile such as: http://www.mysitename.com/user/editadvanced.php?id= 1887 &course=15 Where the 1887 could be their studentID? Thanks in advance, Craig

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Mass Enrollment without Student ID
ResponsesInList.Text:
I want to assume that it can be found when editing a users profile such as: http://www.mysitename.com/user/editadvanced.php?id=1887&course=15 Where the 1887 could be their studentID? In fact, 1887 is the 'id' of the record for the student in the mdl_user table. What you are looking for is what we call the 'ID number' (that is called 'idnumber' in the mdl_user table), that will be probably empty as you say above. If you have direct access to Moodle's database , you can set the 'idnumber' field directly to anything you want. For example, the username. With something like the SQL sentence below: 
```text
UPDATE mdl_user SET idnumber=username WHERE deleted <> 1;
```
 This way you can use the same value of the username for the enrolments. Saludos. Iñaki.

ResponsesInList.Text: At the course level, you can only choose between interactive enrolment plugins. LDAP is not such a thing, so you don't have that option. Interactive enrolment plugins are meant to be used interactively, when none of the 'backend' enrolment plugins already enrolled a student in a given course. That way, if you make a course 'enrollable' and a certain user wants to enrol in that course, (s)he is interactively asked to do certain things to be enrolled (click on a 'Yes' button, pay some money via Paypal, Authrize.net, etc.) If you don't want anything of this, just make the course not enrollable and configure your LDAP/DB/IMS/etc. enrolment backend and you are done. Saludos. Iñaki.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Trouble with enrol_manual_enrol_users rest webservice
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hi Drew, the JSON payload in your request should look like an URL -encoded query string not a plain JSON object - given that wstoken , wsfunction and moodlewsrestformat will be provided as HTTP GET parameters. Your request should looks like: 
```text
POST https://hostname/path/to/webservice/rest/
server
.php?wstoken=<...>&wsfunction=enrol_manual_enrol_users&moodlewsrestformat=json



enrolments%5B0%5D%5Broleid%5D=5&enrolments%5B0%5D%5Buserid%5D=265&enrolments%5B0%5D%5Bcourseid%5D=9
```
 since your JSON data [{"roleid": 5,"userid": 265,"courseid": 9}] should be expressed as a list of key=value pairs i.e. enrolments[0][roleid]=5&enrolments[0][userid]=265&enrolments[0][courseid]=9 . HTH , Matteo

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: sso integration question
ResponsesInList.Text: A couple of comments: 1. You don't need a privileged account to bind to the LDAP server. Any account that has read access in Active Directory (any regular account), will suffice. 2. You need to use NTLM instead of Kerberos as the auth format (unless you have configured apache and the moodle server to use Kerberos, which you would know :-)) 3.- If you have a proxy (or any kind of source NAT) between your desktops and your Moodle server, you need to take that into account when setting the client subnets. Moodle won't see the clients' IP addresses, but those of the proxy (or source NAT device). 4. You need to make sure you Moodle server URL is part of the "Intranet Zone" in Internet Explorer settings. Otherwise Internet Explorer won't send the credentials for the logged in user. Make sure you are not using GPO's that block additions to "Intranet Zone" in IE, or that otherwise configure that setting. Regarding the "NTLMsso <directory> < file> settings </file> <directory>", this is what I use in my test environment. I don't use a .htaccess file, I put the configuration directly in the httpd.conf file instead. This is what I have (only relevant lines shown): ... ... <IfModule !mod_auth_sspi.c> LoadModule sspi_auth_module modules/mod_auth_sspi.so </IfModule> <VirtualHost *:80> .... .... # This is the directory where Moodle is installed DocumentRoot "C:\Inetpub\wwwroot\moodle" .... .... <Directory "C:\Inetpub\wwwroot\moodle"> Options FollowSymLinks AllowOverride None Order deny,allow Allow from all </Directory> <Directory "C:\Inetpub\wwwroot\moodle\auth\ldap"> <Files ntlmsso_magic.php> AuthName "windows2003.local" AuthType SSPI SSPIAuth On SSPIOfferBasic Off SSPIAuthoritative On # The Active Directory domain name is "windows2003.local" in my setup SSPIDomain windows2003.local require valid-user </Files> </Directory> </VirtualHost> Saludos. Iñaki.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Enroll students automatically at confirmation
ResponsesInList.Text: I was not able to figure out a solution within Moodle at this time. What I ended up doing is the following: I created a new function called "simple_enroll" which allows me to define a role, a student, and a course and does a full enrollment of that user into that course with that role; In the user table I created a new field, "categoryid" which maps to "id" in the "mdl_course_categories" table; I also created a new function called "univ_enroll" which takes a userid, then enrolls a student (via the "simple_enroll" function above) into the course that corresponds to the category field in the "mdl_course" table; and, In "/login/confirm.php" around line 81 I added a call to my "univ_enroll" function. I personally don't like this solution very much because it modifies core code and messes with the database, but it's all I could come up with in the time I had. A better solution is probably to build my own enrollment plugin, but I didn't have time to figure out how to do that.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Modify Self Enrollment?
ResponsesInList.Text: You can do this at a permissions level by changing the 'Unenrol self from the course' permission (self enrolment  capability) for the desired role (e,g, student) You can apply this either at a course context (Course Administration/Settings block / Users / Permissions / Check Permissions) or at a Site level Site Admin / Users / Permissions / Define Role / (select role ie. student) - locate Self Enrolment capability and  'Unenrol self from the course' permission. This may be relevant https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=60973 Might be worth checking into what happens with a cohort enrolment if you remove the person from the cohort - I think it might delete the data as well. Phil

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Modify Self Enrollment?
ResponsesInList.Text: Just to be clear: Moodle does not actually delete any data. If a user dropped out of the course but joins or is added later on, his data will reappear.

ResponsesInList.Text:
The current code just copies the most basic settings from the template course, which doesn't include the visibility setting. If you want to copy that setting from the template, edit create_course() in .../enrol/ldap/enrol.php and search for the line that reads: 
```text
$course->visible = 1;
```
 and comment it out. That should do it. Saludos. Iñaki.

If you add 'print_r($moodleuser); print_r($oldmoodleuser);' just after '$logline .= 'username collision while trying to update:';' in enrol.php, you can see what the username it is trying to use is vs what it currenly is. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: External Database

We use external database enrolment, and it only shows up in the list of enrolment methods for courses where there are students enrolled using it. IE : If you create a new course named 'test', it will not show 'external database' under enrolment methods, until you add the 'test' course and students that are supposed to be enrolled in it, in your external database. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to Assign Course to Student  in moodle 3.2 ?
ResponsesInList.Text: Firstly, it sounds like you have given this user the student role at a site level. That's not really the way Moodle roles are designed to be used, roles are normally given as part of enrolling a user onto a particular course. That way one user could be a student on one, a non-editing teacher on another (e.g. a masters student supporting undergraduate seminars, or a Year 6 pupil supporting readers in Year 3), or a teacher on another (e.g. a university tutor doing a post-grad research, or a secondary teacher having non-editing or student rights to a senior manager's staff-room page, etc) But, to answer your question, please see the documents on Course Enrolment https://docs.moodle.org/32/en/Add_students Richard PS. I have moved this thread to the Enrolments forum, rather than the Course Formats and have sent Imran a note to explain the move.

Can this method handle many courses for each student? If so, how should the course IDs strings be separated in the DB? (; , '  ') 2. Does anyone have a method to display semesters? The obviouse method would be to use categories but I see they can't ne nested, so I can't create a winter category and place all the winter courses in it. Thanks in advance for your help

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can the external database handle multiple course?
ResponsesInList.Text: Yada, The Course ID field on the Moodle course set up screen is used to associate the Moodle course with a course (subscription product) in the external database. In the external database you relate students to subscription products. In the external database a student could be enrolled in any or all subscription products. This really is a function of the external controlling program as to how a student can enroll into which program. As far as a course ID string this would come into play when a given Moodle course is related to more than one subscription product in the external database. For instance you might have MAT 101 in Moodle, but offer two subscription products to it in the external database such as "30 days access to MAT 101" and "90 days access to MAT 101" So in the external database you have two subscription products that relate to the same Moodle course. In this case you would need to use a course ID string to relate the one Moodle course to both subscription products in the external database. As far as the nuts and bolts to how to set up the database I can't help you with that. When you say external database you really are referring to a stand alone program that will manage the users and class enrollment. This is best suited for a subscription/membership type script that saves the information in an external database that can be accessed by Moodle. Good luck with this. Grant Swaim

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle integration from a custom Registrar system
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi All, Very new to moodle and to this community. I have been tasked to upgrade a Moodle installation and "Integrate" it to a custom system for our school's registrar. The moodle was ver2.5 and is now ver3.5 (a big leap because it was ancient since last updated by an ancient developer.) My problem is the "integration" part of the Registrar system, we call it GenecSys. Moodle and GenecSys are used separately to this date. GenecSys is capable of exporting the whole records it has, students, courses etc to an XML file. And when imported to the upgraded Moodle, it duplicates all entries, as if importing all data from GenecSys as a new one. Example: We have user101 on Moodle, we also have user101 on GenecSys, instead of merging or skipping (not overwrite) it, it is being duplicated, the same to the courses. I am attaching the sample XML file, every entry has thousands of that, just added the skeleton of it. Also, GenecSys has LDAP settings, but I will check that on other section of this community and that's my second option. Plus, the developer of GenecSys is hard to reach. Thanks in advance!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle integration from a custom Registrar system
ResponsesInList.Text: What particular tool, feature, or plugin are you using to import the XML messages? I would guess that the tool is not configured (nor designed possibly) to re-import or update records, and it treats every file as a new batch of users. If there are configuration settings for the tool, best to look there. I do not know how familiar you are with the formatting of the XML message, but it's IMS Enterprise , and there happens to be a built-in enrollment plugin , by the same name, to handle such files. Settings in the IMS Enterprise enrollment plugin allow you to configure whether new users can be created, or just updated. When this plugin imports the user, it puts the external system's id value for the user (in your example file, the GenecSys id value 210001149) into the Moodle user's IDNUMBER field, displayed in the Optional section of the profile. That's how it links the external user information to the Moodle user information, therefore, you should make sure users are prevented from editing the IDNUMBER field of their profiles using roles/capabilities. Hope this is helpful. Regards...

Same with the courses I think. Since there are developments in our upgrade, the upper management decided to have two Moodle Installations (1 for the incoming semester and 1 to retain for previous students). ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Payment option for Category?
ResponsesInList.Text: Just to update, I did find that if you click into a lesson, in the top right there will be a button labeled "Update this Lesson".  In here you can set a password for the lesson, so that only people with this password can access that lesson. Not sure yet if this is a viable solution for our company, but it may work out fine.  I will duplicate the course as an "individual lesson sale" course with a different enrollment key, and a set a unique password for each lesson.  When someone buys an individual lesson, they will be given an enrollment key for the "individual lesson sale" version of the course, and a password to only the lesson(s) they purchased.  If they choose to buy the entire course, then they will be given the enrollment key for the original, un-password-protected course. Alternatively, you could keep only one course, with all lessons password protected, and just give all the passwords to people who buy the entire course... but that kind of makes it a pain in the ass for your biggest customers.

ResponsesInList.Title: Customisable Registration forms
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Is there an easy way of creating a customisable registration form for users - say who may work in different companies or countries, maybe using custom fields? TIA John

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Customisable Registration forms
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi John  - not as far as I'm aware - I needed this a while ago and in the end opted for a third party membership management tool, which does this with consummate ease. There are several commercial solutions out there, at varying price points. I use ' aMember ', which does all I need and a lot more besides. I'm not on a commission form them, or anything like that, but have really been impressed with what the system does. It takes a bit of thinking about to set it up, but ultimately all of your Moodle courses become 'products' in what is apparently a 'shop'. You protect the products with registration forms and you can have as many forms as you need all pointing at the same 'product'. You can add various fields and so on... it's up to you. You end up with a whole new member management system - it sits 'beside' Moodle and integrates with it, but is not like a Moodle plugin or block that becomes part of Moodle - it will give you an 'admin' login for member management tools, which is not your log in to Moodle, and which replaces the membership tools in Moodle itself. If you can live with this kind of arrangement, you can do all you need.
